articles.headline: India Gets Caught Short as Sugar Prices Soar
articles.snippet: To meet growing demand, India will probably have to import 20 to 30 percent of the sugar it needs in the current fiscal year.
articles.abstract: To meet growing demand, India will probably have to import 20 to 30 percent of the sugar it needs in the current fiscal year.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONI KALBHOR, India  Sanjay Gujar’s family has raised sugar cane for generations. But last year, after sugar prices fell by more than 40 percent, he replanted his six acres here in the sugar bowl of India with bananas.

articles.headline: Symbol of Unhealed Congo: Male Rape Victims
articles.snippet: A sudden spike in male rape cases is seen as a consequence of joint Congo-Rwanda military operations against rebels.
articles.abstract: A sudden spike in male rape cases is seen as a consequence of joint Congo-Rwanda military operations against rebels.
articles.lead_paragraph: GOMA, Congo  It was around 11 p.m. when armed men burst into Kazungu Ziwa’s hut, put a machete to his throat and yanked down his pants. Mr. Ziwa is a tiny man, about four feet, six inches tall. He tried to fight back, but said he was quickly beaten down.

articles.headline: G.M. Chairman Vows to Defend Market Share
articles.snippet: In his first board meeting, Edward E. Whitacre Jr. left no doubt that he would be pushing the management team hard to reverse G.M.’s decades-long slide.
articles.abstract: In his first board meeting, Edward E. Whitacre Jr. left no doubt that he would be pushing the management team hard to reverse G.M.’s decades-long slide.
articles.lead_paragraph: MILFORD, Mich.  The new board of General Motors turned their attention on Tuesday to the cars and trucks they hope can quickly restore G.M. to profitability.

articles.headline: Medical Papers by Ghostwriters Pushed Therapy
articles.snippet: Court documents suggest a broad level of hidden industry influence on medical literature.
articles.abstract: Court documents suggest a broad level of hidden industry influence on medical literature.
articles.lead_paragraph: Newly unveiled court documents show that ghostwriters paid by a pharmaceutical company played a major role in producing 26 scientific papers backing the use of hormone replacement therapy in women, suggesting that the level of hidden industry influence on medical literature is broader than previously known.

articles.headline: S.E.C. Starts Crackdown on ‘Flash’ Trading
articles.snippet: The S.E.C. chairwoman said she would push to eliminate a technique that enables some firms to peek at investors’ stock orders.
articles.abstract: The S.E.C. chairwoman said she would push to eliminate a technique that enables some firms to peek at investors’ stock orders.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission has begun a widespread effort to crack down on stock trading techniques that regulators worry are giving sophisticated financiers, armed with lightning-fast computers, an edge that everyday investors cannot match.

articles.headline: For Health Insurers’ Lobbyist, Good Will Is Tested
articles.snippet: The work of the industry’s chief lobbyist, Karen Ignagni, to reach agreements among insurers may be undercut.
articles.abstract: The work of the industry’s chief lobbyist, Karen Ignagni, to reach agreements among insurers may be undercut.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the insurance industry, long an opponent of health care reform, it was a striking change: with a new administration coming to Washington, insurers agreed to abandon some of their most controversial practices, like denying coverage to applicants with pre-existing medical conditions.

articles.headline: Fresh Views at Agency Overseeing Online Ads
articles.snippet: The new head of the Bureau of Consumer Protection at the Federal Trade Commission has asked Congress for a bigger budget and for a streamlined way to create rules.
articles.abstract: The new head of the Bureau of Consumer Protection at the Federal Trade Commission has asked Congress for a bigger budget and for a streamlined way to create rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: Most of the online world is based on a simple, if unarticulated, agreement: consumers browse Web sites free, and in return, they give up data  like their gender or income level  which the sites use to aim their advertisements.

articles.headline: A Few Stocks Skyrocket, but Why?
articles.snippet: Some of the most beleaguered financial stocks out there suddenly soared on Wednesday. A.I.G. was up 63 percent.
articles.abstract: Some of the most beleaguered financial stocks out there suddenly soared on Wednesday. A.I.G. was up 63 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: It must be a full moon. Some of the most beleaguered financial stocks out there suddenly soared on Wednesday  and no one could quite explain why.
